title: Complement for Bree?
content: Hi all, I'm working on a logotype using [Bree](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108210909/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/typetogether/bree_complete/) and am trying to find a complementary font for use in the rest of the identity package. It's a somewhat unique face so I'm thinking maybe something fairly non-descript? I'm leaning towards wanting a sans but I'm not entirely set on that. Any suggestions very welcome, thanks.
author: cfig

comments.content:
Why not stay with the same designers and take a look at Ronnia or Karmina Sans?  
They also offer a sans with contrast, Cora (though I'd find that not really fitting Bree) and some very appealing serifs.

[http://www.type-together.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108210909/http:/www.type-together.com/ "http://www.type-together.com")

I'd actually been looking at their other typefaces already, good suggestion :)

I like Karmina but I have a feeling my client is going to lean away from using a serif as they've already shown a preference for sans typefaces thus far in the project. Any thoughts on a sans that might fit Bree? Or I wonder if using Bree with the alternate characters (i.e. not the unique g, k, y, z) might actually work?

<cite>I wonder if using Bree with the alternate characters (i.e. not the unique g, k, y, z) might actually work?</cite>

As long as you can use different weights too, I think it could be the best solution.
